intro: Sideritis fernandez-casasii, commonly known as the Canary Islands ironweed, is a flowering plant native to the Canary Islands. It belongs to the Lamiaceae family, which includes many aromatic herbs. The plant is characterized by its upright growth habit and small, tubular flowers that are typically purple or blue in color. Sideritis fernandez-casasii thrives in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in coastal or mountainous regions. Its leaves are usually narrow and slightly hairy, contributing to its adaptability in harsh environments.
